t: Song of Solomon 2
I*pn am a rose of Sharon, a*ld lily of the valleys.
He
As*pn a lily among brambles, so*ld is my love among the young women.
She
As*pn an apple tree among the trees of the forest, so*ld is my beloved among the young men. With*ln great delight I sat in his shadow, and*ld his fruit was sweet to my taste.
He*ln brought me to the banqueting house, and*ld his banner over me was love.
Sustain*ln me with raisins; refresh*ld me with apples, for*ld I am sick with love.
His*ln left hand is under my head, and*ld his right hand embraces me!
I*ln adjure you, O daughters of Jerusalem, by*ld the gazelles or the does of the field, that*ln you not stir up or awaken love until*ld it pleases.
The Bride Adores Her Beloved
The*pn voice of my beloved! Behold,*ld he comes, leaping*ln over the mountains, bounding*ld over the hills.
My*ln beloved is like a gazelle or*ld a young stag. Behold,*ln there he stands behind*ld our wall, gazing*ln through the windows, looking*ld through the lattice.
My*ln beloved speaks and says to me: “Arise,*ln my love, my beautiful one, and*ld come away,
for*ln behold, the winter is past; the*ld rain is over and gone.
The*ln flowers appear on the earth, the*ld time of singing has come, and*ln the voice of the turtledove is*ld heard in our land.
The*ln fig tree ripens its figs, and*ld the vines are in blossom; they*ld give forth fragrance. Arise,*ln my love, my beautiful one, and*ld come away.
O*ln my dove, in the clefts of the rock, in*ld the crannies of the cliff, let*ln me see your face, let*ld me hear your voice, for*ln your voice is sweet, and*ld your face is lovely.
Catch*ln the foxes for us, the*ld little foxes that*ln spoil the vineyards, for*ld our vineyards are in blossom.”
My*pn beloved is mine, and I am his; he*ld grazes among the lilies.
Until*ln the day breathes and*ld the shadows flee, turn,*ln my beloved, be like a gazelle or*ld a young stag on cleft mountains.
